intro: Gymnosporia antunesii var. dekindtii, commonly known as the De Kindt's gymnosporia, is a rare shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces woody pods that contain seeds, typical of many legumes. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
